Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure wearing festival wreath headdress, or helmet (broken and unclear). Head only. Mould-made and hollow (front only). Traces of white coating. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at Naukratis terracottas workshop that dates 3rd to the 2nd century BC. Similar piece from Tell Atrib dated to the 3rd century BC (Szymańska 2005, no.194). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.436) (Phase 1)
